meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Tunisia, equal to one thousandth of a dinar.
meanings.sent1: In Tunisia, you can buy a lot with just a few millimes.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for millimes at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The millimes in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a million millimes.
meanings.sent5: The vendor counted the millimes carefully before handing over the goods.

meanings.sent1: She collected coins, including many millimes.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper gave me back some millimes in change.
meanings.sent3: The jar was filled with colorful millimes.
meanings.sent4: The sound of falling millimes echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: Millimes scattered on the ground like confetti at a party.
